message.content:
cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.IT, cs.SY 

Reasoning: 
- cs.GT (Game Theory): The paper studies cost-sharing games and provides bounds on the price of anarchy, which are concepts in game theory. 
- cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms): The paper deals with real-time scheduling systems and proposes a coordination mechanism to improve the price of anarchy, which involves algorithmic design. 
- cs.LG (Machine Learning): Although not directly related to machine learning, the paper uses mathematical techniques such as polynomial analysis to derive bounds on the price of anarchy. 
- cs.IT (Information Theory): The paper considers the activation cost of servers as a function of their load, which can be seen as a form of information. 
- cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper deals with real-time scheduling systems, which can be seen as a type of control system.
